intro: Galium pumilum proles jussiei, commonly known as the dwarf bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves and stems are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, velvety texture.
